Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (989) 758-2717.

ALLEGATION: Facility is discharging residents without completing
discharge paperwork.
INVESTIGATION:
On 2/16/22, I received a complaint regarding Mott Children’s Residence. Youth A,
placed at Optimist House, was involved in an allegation with a youth from Mott
Children’s Residence. Youth A was removed from Optimist House and placed into Motts
Children Residence due to an altercation between Youth A and peers at Mott Children’s
Residence. He was removed from Optimist House on 1/28/22 and placed into Mott
Children’s Residence Until 1/31/22.
I interviewed Administrator 1 on 2/16/22. Administrator 1 reported that Youth A was
removed from his placement at Optimist House and placed into Mott Children’s Home
due to an altercation in Youth A’s facility. Administrator 1 reported that they make
“respite” placements with the children in their care.
I interviewed Administrator 2 and Administrator 3. Both reported they move children
from one facility to another although they are under different license. Both reported they
2

have been performing this action for over five years. Both reported they will move
children due to conflicts between other children or staffing issues.
Administrator 3 reported the DHS 3600 does specify the facility the child is to be placed
in. Administrator 3 reported Youth A’s placement is Optimist House.
Optimist House did not have discharge papers completed for Youth A when they
removed him from the placement.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
of the
following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the
services provided while in residence, including medical and
dental services.
(c) An assessment of the resident?s needs that remain
to be met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental follow up
that is needed, have been reviewed with the resident and
with the parent and with the responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
3

ANALYSIS:  Optimist House removed Youth A from the facility on
January 28-January 31, 2022.
 Both Administrator 2 and Administrator 3 reported they
move children from Optimist House and Mott Children’s
House as a form of respite for issues amongst the
children or staffing issues. Discharge paperwork for these
placements are not completed.
 Respite is not a licensing term. When a child is removed
from one licensed facility and placed into a new licensed
facility, then the child is being discharged from one
placement and placed into another.
 The agency cannot fluidly move children from one
licensed facility to a different licensed facility. The 3600
determines the legal placement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended the license remain unchanged upon receipt of an acceptable
CAP.
